verses.kjv: Lord, remember David, and all his afflictions:
verses.ct: LORD, remember David and everything he suffered.

verses.kjv: How he sware unto the LORD, and vowed unto the mighty God of Jacob;
verses.ct: He made an oath to the LORD, a solemn promise to the Mighty One of Jacob:

verses.kjv: Surely I will not come into the tabernacle of my house, nor go up into my bed;
verses.ct: 'I will not enter my own house or get into my own bed;

verses.kjv: I will not give sleep to mine eyes, or slumber to mine eyelids,
verses.ct: I won't let my eyes close or allow myself to rest,

verses.kjv: Until I find out a place for the LORD, an habitation for the mighty God of Jacob.
verses.ct: until I find a location for the LORD, a dwelling place for the Mighty One of Jacob.'

verses.kjv: Lo, we heard of it at Ephratah: we found it in the fields of the wood.
verses.ct: We heard about it in Ephratah; we discovered it in the countryside of Jaar.

verses.kjv: We will go into his tabernacles: we will worship at his footstool.
verses.ct: Let us go to his dwelling place; let us worship at his footstool.

verses.kjv: Arise, O LORD, into thy rest; thou, and the ark of thy strength.
verses.ct: Rise up, LORD, and come to your resting place — you and the ark of your power.

verses.kjv: Let thy priests be clothed with righteousness; and let thy saints shout for joy.
verses.ct: May your priests be dressed in righteousness, and may your faithful people shout with joy.

verses.kjv: For thy servant David’s sake turn not away the face of thine anointed.
verses.ct: For the sake of your servant David, don't turn away from your anointed one.

verses.kjv: The LORD hath sworn in truth unto David; he will not turn from it; Of the fruit of thy body will I set upon thy throne.
verses.ct: The LORD made a binding oath to David, one he will never go back on: 'I will place one of your own descendants on your throne.

verses.kjv: If thy children will keep my covenant and my testimony that I shall teach them, their children shall also sit upon thy throne for evermore.
verses.ct: If your sons honor my covenant and the instructions I teach them, then their sons will also sit on your throne forever.'

verses.kjv: For the LORD hath chosen Zion; he hath desired it for his habitation.
verses.ct: The LORD has chosen Zion; he wanted it as his home.

verses.kjv: This is my rest for ever: here will I dwell; for I have desired it.
verses.ct: 'This is my resting place forever. I will live here, because this is what I desired.

verses.kjv: I will abundantly bless her provision: I will satisfy her poor with bread.
verses.ct: I will richly bless her food supply; I will give her poor more than enough to eat.

verses.kjv: I will also clothe her priests with salvation: and her saints shall shout aloud for joy.
verses.ct: I will dress her priests in salvation, and her faithful people will shout out loud with joy.

verses.kjv: There will I make the horn of David to bud: I have ordained a lamp for mine anointed.
verses.ct: There I will raise up a powerful king from David's line; I have prepared a lamp for my anointed one.

verses.kjv: His enemies will I clothe with shame: but upon himself shall his crown flourish.
verses.ct: I will cover his enemies with disgrace, but the crown on his head will shine brilliantly.'
